urls.title: Youth Voice Summit - Rethinking Water
urls.description: A chance for you to input your opinions and experiences on future water management and how you would like to engage in giving your opinion in the decisions made by the Environment Agency in the future.

tweets.text:
We have teamed up with @EnvAgency for an online event and would like to know young people’s opinions on future water management, youth engagement and future governance.

🗓️Tuesday 16 March
📣Inspiring guest speakers 
🗨️Take part in a Q&A

Sign up here👇
https://t.co/Gmx3uHGWJI https://t.co/ytACS1HL8H

This is significant. Climate shocks present a material risk to investments. 92% of @EAPensionFund members told us a #netzero target was important. We have been using this framework to help us work out how our portfolio needs to evolve. @EnvAgency @MMMoneyMatter #ClimateAction https://t.co/MUwlEum8OX

tweets.text:
243 documented violations in 2 years and not a single prosecution. And guess what? Yep, you got it.

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/VvjLy78nDI

Flood alert also issued for Rivers Brathay, Rothay & Winster - keep up-to-date at: https://t.co/tPjy2cydpF
@EnvAgency

I arranged a meeting with the Prime Minister @BorisJohnson, and his officials, to fill him in on the backstory behind Walley's Quarry and to explain our present crisis.

The PM agreed that action is clearly needed, and directed his officials to work further with Defra. https://t.co/4jI7UpPaSX

urls.title: Pennywort on the Witham - Lincolnshire Rivers Trust
urls.description: Floating Pennywort (Hydrocotyle ranunculoides) is an aggressive aquatic ‘invasive non-native species’ (INNS). As a native of North America, it first naturalised in 1990, as a result of discarded plants from garden ponds. It grows up to 20cm a day, quickly establishing dense mats of vegetation that can extend from bank to bank.  It is most ... Read More about Pennywort on the Witham

tweets.text: Slowly but surely we are removing pennywort from the Witham Catchment near Lincoln with @LionsEnv and support from @EnvAgencyMids . These before and after images are from the Catchwater Drain. If not removed it will quickly cover the channel.  https://t.co/RdefffRrBG https://t.co/elgVl5dTK9
This piece of work is huge in scale and only eclipsed by the challenge getting to this point!  Thanks to @EnvAgencyNW @RibbleValleyBC too https://t.co/IuTnXvcCuT

tweets.text:
@StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids @RedIndustries2 @ClareDinnisEA Staggering, what will it take for them to act? @PHE_uk are inundated with Walleys Quarry health concerns.
When will the EA step up &  protect the community and the environment...They seem just happy to take complaints and occasionally offer a reference number https://t.co/49SP0DkWRV

Single use plastics fill our landfills, waterways, and ecosystems. 🥤

Some products take years to decompose, while others never will. 🗑️

Make the conscious choice to use reusable products and reduce/recycle when possible. ♻️ https://t.co/xemYdiRVfK

@Newcast42068272 @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe Late announcement today #stinkfest ... it’s not Simply Red...it’s Mainly ‘Red’... they say no to holding back the stink (for years...) bring your own peg or oxygen #stopthestink https://t.co/Tt9Y8WwjN6

Anyone managing waste outside the law is committing #WasteCrime.

We successfully seized this truck, believed to be involved in waste crime, in a joint operation with the police.

Help us continue our fight by completing the Waste Crime Survey 👇

https://t.co/S6bV2wnn2w https://t.co/qpp8Kf2bcV

Great effort from the team today in horrible weather conditions. About 1,000 Reed plugs planted. 2,000 more to go in but we had to stop as river levels were getting too high. I’ll try and choose a sunny day next time! @cpvolgroup @CroxtethHall @EnvAgencyNW #nfm #ACCP https://t.co/7so7Ggj7eI

tweets.text: @OuseEcologyEA @EnvAgencyAnglia @AngliaEnforceEA @N_Rivers_Trust @FascinatingFens Big thanks to Rob from the @EnvAgencyAnglia who so promptly and efficiently came and removed the illegal fish trap I found yesterday while snorkelling in Tuddenham Mill Stream. Now the risk is removed from this horrible contraption to wildlife such as otters, water voles and pike https://t.co/xlyO2eNTmO

Dave Bass @EnvAgency talks about important considerations to make before you purchase a #biomass boiler in this afternoon's #Biomass session👇

#LowCarbonAgri https://t.co/NN8DOBdPb7

urls.title: Hoveton Great Broad – 3 Temporary Fish Barriers, EPR/RB3557SW: Flood risk activity permit consultation - Environment Agency - Citizen Space
urls.description: Find and participate in consultations run by the Environment Agency

tweets.text:
We've launched a public consultation today on an application by @NENorfolkSufflk to install fish proof barriers at Hoveton Great Broad as part of a restoration project.

To view the consultation and submit a response visit https://t.co/MdXk1eEkKK https://t.co/CX2ASV2IWc

@numenini @EnvAgencyAnglia @AngliaEnforceEA @N_Rivers_Trust @FascinatingFens These posts are brilliant Nicola! Did you phone the trap through to our incident number? If not can you please do this and we’ll collect and seize it from you. Cheers 👍
Dumper told to remove waste from floodplain at cost of £85,000 @EnvAgencySW @MidDevonDC @DevonCC #Cullompton #Crediton @thealanquick #flooding #rivers https://t.co/XzWmmH99zl

Smell of sewage and cloudy water with brown debris in the canal downstream of Berkhamsted sewage treatment works, Bullbeggars Lane, and flowing into Bulbourne - apparently it has been like this for days. @EnvAgency @thameswater is sewage being released? #chalkstreams https://t.co/6LTNy1Am4r

This is just disgraceful - where is the company's and the government's stated commitment to a better environment? We have to do better than this, and need the @EnvAgency and @Ofwat to do much better on sewage pollution. https://t.co/AwvYMnoE7c

tweets.text: @SophieHenRob @wouldforthetree @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @thameswater A @thameswater engineer apparently inspected & reported no pollution. The smell and brown debris have now gone, the outflow is much reduced - pictures below are same place as yesterday but look quite different. We'll keep checking & reporting #chalkstreams https://t.co/q9aKGhcSYN

Our £35m upgrade of Keadby Pumping Station near #Scunthorpe #Lincolnshire is well underway but means these 80-year-old diesel pumps are on the last runs and will be decommissioned in the next few weeks. 
More info https://t.co/n37U1kVsfO #flood #Trent https://t.co/mQNSNGL0eX

Following public report of large chicken manure heap next to a #herefordshire river we issued a Farming Rules for Water advice and guidance letter. Farmer has immediately ploughed downhill slope creating a buffer to intercept any run-off. https://t.co/VVBjrHp8B5

urls.title: Off the starting blocks for multi-million pound flood scheme
urls.description: Enabling work on a £56m flood alleviation scheme in Rochdale and Littleborough will get underway in the coming weeks.

tweets.text:
Exciting news! Enabling works for the Rochdale & Littleborough #flood scheme are set to get underway 

Once completed, the scheme will help protect around 1,000 properties as well as vital infrastructure 🚄 while also benefiting wildlife 🐦🐞

👉https://t.co/s6XCNnkYU4 https://t.co/3sEFFq7SJn
@RiverBulbourne @wouldforthetree @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @thameswater Yes, watch this space I guess.

Flood alleviation work at the Tannery site on Kirkstall Road is continuing, with more flood walls being installed along the river. We’ve also completed works to stabilise the river bank. The green bags seen on this picture include grass seed which will grow in the next few months https://t.co/R9enRjVlpt

We cannot fully address the climate emergency without taking into account its disproportionate impact on women and children.

This #IWD2021, @EmmaHowardBoyd, @pow_rebecca and @MarianSpain explain why it's so vital that women's voices are heard.

#TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/oUJ5jCI6wT

tweets.text: @MissyDoom @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe @NewsNBC @PublicHealthEng 100%. @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgencyMids  you can go out for a few hours and the air has cleared in the area, yet indoors retains it. By the time you've got some airflow through the house the smell is back. It's farcical.

Only seeing a small increase in river flows following overnight rain and no flood alerts in place @EnvAgencyNW teams have been monitoring overnight as we do 24/7/365 check your risk at https://t.co/jKVsuatlSD https://t.co/DT09BRRCZs
